DataElement.preferredName: Neoadjuvant Preoperative Radiation Therapy End Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date when neoadjuvant preoperative radiation therapy ended. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiationneoadjuvant therapy, as treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation. :Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

Property.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A particular calender date on which an event or activity ceased or was finished.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.changeDescription: Reviewed and approved for Release by TCGA team on 1/8/2010
